We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior.

We have class SomeOf: samples a different sequence of transforms each time called. Configurable number of transforms, sampling uniformly or weighted, with replacement option, lazy execution, overrides, logging, map_items/unpack_items.

So summary: class that composes a set of transformation functions and applies a randomly sampled subset each invocation, supporting variable subset size, weighting, replacement, lazy execution, per-item mapping, argument unpacking, logging, and parameter overrides.

Business intent: Provide flexible stochastic data augmentation pipeline for machine learning, enabling varied augmentation per sample to improve model robustness.

Keywords: random sampling, transforms, data augmentation, lazy execution, weighted sampling, replace, overrides, logging, map_items, unpack_items, pipeline.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim. Provide JSON.

Summary: "A composable pipeline that holds a collection of callable transforms and, on each call, selects and applies a randomly chosen subset of them. The selection can be fixed or variable in size, weighted, with or without replacement, and supports lazy execution, per-item mapping, argument unpacking, logging, and parameter overrides."

Business intent: "Enable stochastic data augmentation and preprocessing in machine learning workflows, allowing diverse transformations per input to improve model generalization."

Keywords list: ["random subset", "transform sampling", "data augmentation", "weighted selection", "replace", "lazy execution", "parameter overrides", "logging", "map items", "unpack items", "pipeline"].

  "summary": "A composable pipeline that stores a list of callable transforms and, each time it is invoked, randomly selects a subset of those transforms to apply. The number of selected transforms can be fixed or drawn from a user‑defined range, sampling can be weighted or uniform, and replacement is optional. The class also supports lazy execution of transforms, per‑item mapping for iterable inputs, argument unpacking, configurable logging, and runtime parameter overrides.",
  "business_intent": "Provide a flexible, stochastic data augmentation and preprocessing component for machine learning pipelines, allowing varied transformations per sample to enhance model robustness and generalization.",
